document_data.name: Harth Trithketh's House of Welcome
document_data.mainbody: '''Harth Trithketh's House of Welcome''' was an inn located in [[Khôltar]], [[south Faerûn]], ''circa'' the [[1372 DR|Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR]].{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|67-68}}<ref name ="ESp53">{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 53: Khôltar, Part 4, Our Tour Begins}}
document_data.Location: This inn was located on the southwest side of [[Hael Way]] where it connected to the [[North Way]] just inside the southern gate of Khôltar (known as Farrgaunlar).{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|68-69}}{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 54: Khôltar, Part 5, The Farrgaunlar}} On the other side of Farrgaunlar (to the east) was [[Darvoro's Plates]].{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|69-70}}{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 55: Khôltar, Part 6, Looking Around the Farrgaunlar}}
document_data.Structure: Harth Trithketh's House of Welcome was eight stories tall, but not all stories were the same size. Two floors were designed specifically for [[gnomes]] in scale, ceiling height, and furnishings. Likewise, two floors were dedicated to [[halflings]], two to [[dwarves]], and two to [[humans]]. The exterior was ornately decorated with statuary on all sides. The interior was decorated in the styles that were considered luxurious to the respective races.<ref name ="ESp53" />
document_data.Services: The House of Welcome was known for its vast wine cellar and deep menu of beverages to satisfy most any taste. For the frivolously rich, the staff would pour a bath of a client's chosen drink. A large stable of handsome and beautiful male and female escorts were available for customers who wanted companionship.<ref name ="ESp53" />
document_data.Inhabitants: The proprietor, [[Harth Trithketh]], was a jolly gnome who enjoyed the high life but also kept an eye on his guests' activities.<ref name ="ESp53" />
